result.execSummary:
The defendant Delion D Lockett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
filed by the State

Defendant Delion D Lockett in court with attorney J A Rosario.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Cts. 1 and 2.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 9 months jail straight time concurrent to Ct. 2 STAYED for 1 year Probation - concurrent
- Court costs of $253.00 (includes DRGOD) - apply bail
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Complete GED or HSED. DNA surcharge is waived.
 
Ct. 2:
- 90 days jail straight time concurrent to Ct. 1 STAYED for 1 year Probation - concurrent
- Court costs of $243.00  - apply bail
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Complete GED or HSED. DNA surcharge is waived.
